name: 勞維俊
objective: 本課程旨在藉由各種文化媒體（如文學作品，書報雜誌，期刊論文，電影等影音文字）引導學生選擇性地認識英國、愛爾蘭、美國、加拿大、非洲、澳洲、紐西蘭、印度、巴基斯坦、新加坡、香港、菲律賓、加勒比海等國家或地區的文學與文化。藉由認識上述這些國家或地區的英語文學與文化，擴展學生英語文應用的宏觀視野，並使之具備促進異國情感及文化交流的能力。

Aims:

This course focuses on a chosen theme in world literatures and cultures, aiming to train students’ ability to investigate, both textually and theoretically, a theme within cultural production. Integrating the knowledge and insights students have acquired in other courses, this course approaches literature comparatively. In the process of examining what a particular theme means in different cultural contexts, students should acquire further techniques which will be important throughout their studies.

Outlines: Revenge in world literature and cinema

Virtually all works of literature (great or minor, classic or popular, literary or non-literary) are fascinated by revenge. It seems that the logic of human interactions has been dominated by the logic of vengeance. This course analyses how revenge is represented in cultural production including literature, film and various art works from Greek tragedies to contemporary films, including the European tradition and the modern Asian. 

This course investigates to what extent revenge is ‘natural,’ instead of being culturally produced. Related issues including the concept of justice, the sense of guilt, law, time, gender, identity, anger, and violence will be examined by referring to different theoretical frameworks.
